info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 28 at 9:30PM CST by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
At 930 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Benbrook, moving east at 40 mph.
HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fort Worth, Benbrook, and Edgecliff Village around 935 PM CST. Edgecliff around 940 PM CST. Forest Hill, Kennedale, and Everman around 945 PM CST. Arlington around 950 PM CST. Pantego around 955 PM CST.
Other locations impacted by this storm include Benbrook Lake, Lake Arlington, Dalworthington Gardens, Westover Hills, and Joe Pool Lake.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 35W between mile markers 40 and 53. Interstate 20 between mile markers 423 and 453. Interstate 30 between mile markers 2 and 31.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

parameter.value: A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Tarrant County through 1000 PM CST
